definition[0]: if something invigorates you, it makes you feel healthier, stronger, and have more energy
example[0]: At my age, the walk into town is enough to invigorate me.
example[1]: He felt invigorated after a day in the country.
definition[1]: to make the people in an organization or group feel excited again, so that they want to make something successful
example[2]: Careyâ€™s hope was that the church would be renewed and invigorated.
explanation[0]: Invigorate is usually passive in this meaning
